shortdesc.ph: Occurs each time the SDK receives a video frame sent by the remote user.

p.codeblock: boolean onRenderVideoFrame(String channelId, int uid, VideoFrame videoFrame);
virtual bool onRenderVideoFrame(const char* channelId, rtc::uid_t remoteUid, VideoFrame& videoFrame) = 0;
DECLARE_DYNAMIC_MULTICAST_DELEGATE_ThreeParams(FOnRenderVideoFrame, const FString, channelId, int64, remoteUid, const FVideoFrame&, videoFrame);
public virtual bool OnRenderVideoFrame(string channelId, uint remoteUid, VideoFrame videoFrame)
final void Function(String channelId, int remoteUid, VideoFrame videoFrame)? onRenderVideoFrame;

section.p: After you successfully register the video frame observer, the SDK triggers this callback each time it receives a video frame. In this callback, you can get the video data sent from the remote end before rendering, and then process it according to the particular scenarios.

note.props: native unreal bp electron rn flutter

ul.li: If the video data type you get is RGBA, the SDK does not support processing the data of the alpha channel.
Due to framework limitations, this callback does not support sending processed video data back to the SDK.

section.note: If you use Unity for development, Agora only supports sending video data in YUV format to SDK. Ensure that you set mode as INTPTR when you call the method to register a video frame observer.

pt.props: cpp unreal bp rn electron flutter unity cs

plentry.pd: The user ID of the remote user who sends the current video frame.
